page.title: 10CORSHAM'S TWIN TOWN
page.content: Corsham is twinned with Jargeau in the South West of France. Visits take place several times each year between the people of the two towns. Jargeau is famous for coal and sausages and is generally more industrialised than Corsham. In April 1985 I went with Corsham School Windband on a visit to Jargeau. I stayed there for 5 days with the Breton family. One thing I noticed was the amount of food and wine they consumed. They have over 600 bottles of wine in their cellar. We went to see a bridge known as the "valle de loire". We visited the schools and colleges and then looked around the shops. On the last night we played in a concert for the mayor of Jargeau and he said that he enjoyed it very much!
